text: Kathy Boudin (May 19, 1943 â€“ May 1, 2022) was an American leftist activist. She was a member of the radical left militant organization Weather Underground. She was convicted of felony murder for her role in the 1981 Brink's robbery.Quieter Lives for 60's Militants, but Intensity of Beliefs Hasn't Faded Boudin was released from prison on parole in 2003 and became an adjunct professor at Columbia University. Boudin died on May 1, 2022 in New York City from cancer, aged 78. ==References== Category:1943 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:American political activists Category:American people convicted of manslaughter
title: Kathy Boudin
